Reviews.Title: “Possibly the Cleanest Hotel in Indiana”
Reviews.Author: DetailGuy777
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sheraton Indianapolis City Center for one night upon the return from our honeymoon. The front desk staff was efficient, polite and professional. We received prompt service and a room upgrade to a suite without even asking. Our room was large, clean, functional and well decorated. Largest flat screen TV I have ever seen in a hotel bedroom. The bathroom was the cleanest bathroom I have ever been in. Well done to the cleaning staff!! The hotel definitely reflects classic mid west theme and is relaxing. The location is perfect for the down town Indianapolis area. The lobby is inviting and comfortable. We ate dinner at the restaurant and experienced wonderful service (only couple in the place but still above and beyond). Food was fresh, hot, fast and delicious. Prices were reasonable to fairly cheap for a hotel. My wife and I have decided next time we are in Indianapolis we are staying at this property again. Downtown Indianapolis looks like a fun time!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff ... Awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: hdabaja
Reviews.Content: Truly enjoyed this business trip thanks to the friendly and professional staff. I did feel like they were my own throughout my stay. Alex, thanks a lot for the seem less checkin and help!

Reviews.Title: “Much better then expected”
Reviews.Author: BigJR40
Reviews.Content: So I booked this hotel for a trade show it was the only one left close to the event for a reasonable price. I then read the reviews on line and thought great I'm staying in a dump. I got there and yes its a city parking structure big concrete and dark worked fine for parking. I waited for the elevator which was said to be the slowest on the planet once again same speed as any others Ive been in. Staff was very friendly lobby was beautiful so I went off to my room thinking the worst is yet to come. I walked into my room and wow was very nice big flat screen TV bathroom was clean and well appointed beds we nice and comfy. The only thing I did notice was yeah it was a bit warm for my liking OK I like to be next to freezing to death while sleeping LOL! I have stayed in many types of hotels and motels in lots of different country's and this was a very nice hotel. One last detail yes they charge for parking its around $20 a day so is every parking garage in the city your down town.

Reviews.Title: “Out-of-dated facilities & services if you considering their fame”
Reviews.Author: atsnowbox
Reviews.Content: The equipments in suite was quite old when we stayed two nights in 2012 Feb. Although the price was a good deal on the Expedia, however, we were disappointed when we arrived in such famous chain hotel with this room quality. I even had to walk everywhere to turn off every lights seperately in the room... First, we were waiting at the counter to check in more than 5mins without any staff's showing up, and no carrier helped us to bring our six baggages to our room. (Try imaging we two people dragging 6 baggages to the elevator and trying to press the buttom...) And I have to pay extra to use wireless Internet...the conclusion is we overestimated by Sheraton's fame, and I would not like to stay there again but some other new hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Way too hot”
Reviews.Author: crmesq
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need of a serious refurb at this point. On the plus side the rooms are clean, staff friendly and it's a very good location. The BIG problem was the one zone heating. The hallways are a blast furnace and the rooms not much better. I had to turn the heat completely off and sleep with the curtains wide open to keep the room at a warm but livable level.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking”
Reviews.Author: KathyGoldman
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay. What a disappointment for what I have always considered a top notch hotel chain. The first room I was given had an oil type space heater because the room unit didn't work. When I called the front desk I was lied to an told "we are between seasons and the room heating units aren't working". I informed her that this was not acceptable and she moved me to a room with heat. Guess that room was unaware that it was between seasons. Oh and others people that was with us.....well they too had the oil type heaters but remained in the room they were given. I just wonder what the fire marshall would think about these oil heaters??? There is no restaurant but they do have a Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Sheraton, great location”
Reviews.Author: DCtraveler0009
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights around the Super Bowl. The hotel staff clearly went out of their way to provide as much extra help and assistance as they could to make guests feel at home. Service was friendly and excellent. The rooms are standard. Clean, but the water pressure / shower nozzle was not good and made it hard to get conditioner out of my hair. The best feature is the location. It's a block of the main circle downtown. You can easily and safely walk anywhere in the area. There is a Starbucks in the building as well, which is always nice. Breakfast was fine, your standard basic hotel buffet. Plenty of great restaurants are within walking distance, and you can walk to the stadium easily. There is a parking garage at the hotel, which looks as if the ceiling is starting to fall apart. Overall, fine hotel and service. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: luvleightoo
Reviews.Content: The property is showing signs of its age, even since my last review. This floor wasn't as nice, and their were some overall housekeeping/maintenance issues that were visible, such as an odd smell in the hallway, worn carpets and windows needing exterior cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Fun on NYE”
Reviews.Author: egmont6
Reviews.Content: Made a great base for New Years Eve with friends and family. King room facing circle was just perfect. Nice sized room, decent bathroom, very comfortable bed. Parked 1/2 block south on Illinois, top floor so I could see car, $5 for 21 hours. Hotel price is very good for downtown, however, there is a combined Indiana & Downtown 17% tax added to bill. Will stay at the Sheraton again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: StElmoChatt
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a lot, most recently yesterday. The staff continues to be great. The room was comfortable and quiet. Breakfast at the circle cafe was quick, the service was good, and the food was great. I enjoyed my stay here again and I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location great but not overall”
Reviews.Author: Michele L
Reviews.Content: great location, especially since we were there for a wedding in the Sheraton ballroom but many negatives. No hot water, we complained, were told an "engineer" would take care of it but nothing changed. There was no way to cool down the room. Apparently at some point the hotel "switches" from air conditioning to heat and there is no going back. Turning down the thermostat just causes the heat to blow less... Hate paying for internet and parking but that seems to be the norm any more for hotels at this level.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: cartaynic
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed for one night to catch the Colts / Texans football game mid-week a few days before Xmas. The hotel was decorated nicely and the location was perfect for us just 5 blocks from the stadium. Our room view was of the monument in Centre City. The room was average size and clean. The beds were good and we had a flat screen HDTV. There was free wi-fi in the room and loby. The only issue I had was the 20 dollar a day parking fee. The hotel has a restaurant, bar and Starbucks on site.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good that's about it”
Reviews.Author: mollelliott
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood member and normally on visits to Indianapolis I stay at the Westin property. On my visit in May the Westin was sold out so I opted for the Sheraton since it was only a few blocks away. I will avoid it in the future. Other than the location it doesn't have much to offer. The gym is small and in what seems like a basement. The Internet connection was terrible. The hotel doesn't even have pay per view for ordering a movie. There is a Starbucks downstairs and you can walk to everything in downtown but that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, Starbucks in lower floor”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: We came to Indianapolis for the Indianapolis Monumental Marathon, which was run on Nov 5, 2011. The hotel was a great location for the start/finish of the race. Indianapolis has a very convenient downtown - some good restaurants and mall shopping close by. Hotel itself was fine for us. Clean rooms, nice flat screen TV, comfortable bedding, nice bathrooms. After running the marathon, we took a nap in the afternoon and I asked the housekeeper to arrange to come by our room at dinner - worked out great. I think some of the things that were mentioned in other reviews more or less reflect the rather laid back nature of Indianapolis compared to larger cities. Valid points. Our experience was fine. Liked the quiet bar and the Starbucks in the 1st floor. Walking distance to everything (convention center, football stadium, restaurants).

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: hidingheather
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here three or four times over the last couple of years. Though we live in Indianapolis, we've done a few date nights and stayed here so we could be right downtown, and more recently stayed here for a wedding so we wouldn't have to worry about driving home afterwards. The service here has always lived up to the standards I expect from Sheraton, and the rooms are always clean and nice. As always, the Sheraton beds are pretty much the best ever. In the summer, the rooftop pool is absolutely awesome, and as this hotel sits right on the circle, I don't think there is a bad view possible. Even if you aren't using the pool, I suggest going out on the pool deck just to check out the sweet view. During this stay I visited the hotel bar briefly and the bartender was awesome. She made it so that I would drop by for a drink even if not staying here. It was a bummer that there was no room service after 11pm, but it worked out as they have a convenience store in the lobby that is open 24hrs. Potato chips to the rescue! As is a problem with all Sheraton's, you do you have to pay for internet, though I believe they have a business center where you can use a computer with internet for no charge. Regardless, I feel that with the money spent for a room at a Sheraton, included wifi would be a nice touch. Parking is also more than a bit spendy at $25 a night to self-park in the garage.

Reviews.Title: “omg”
Reviews.Author: tymes
Reviews.Content: very dirty hallways paper thin walls and doors pay to park 25 bucks. wet bar sink out of order. ugh bus stop ij front of hotel unsavory people hanging out alll hours

Reviews.Title: “Group experience...eh, it's ok”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy W
Reviews.Content: Was with a large group...it was ok. Had issues with homophobic guests and staff. Will really question whether or not I'll go back to this event because of the experience here.

Reviews.Title: “good location, comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: jwrichte
Reviews.Content: Good beds here. Other than that nothing spectacular about this hotel. The room layout is a bit odd and the bathroom could be nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Thaddeus11212
Reviews.Content: Small rooms and dated layout contributed to the poor quality of my 12 days here. The laundry service lost one of my socks and the management response was to inform me socks were available for sale in the gift shop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: devogrrrrl
Reviews.Content: I have to post a comment here after my latest encounter with 'Rada' - staff @ the front desk. I've made 4 visits for business over the past year and stayed @ The Sheraton for 3 of them. Rada made a point of remembering my name after checkin on stay #1 and greeted me by name each time she saw me after that. On my trip to Indy last week, I was unable to get a room due to a convention, so had to book elsewhere. However, a coworker was checking in @ The Sheraton (at the end of my trip, so rooms were available again) and I walked into the lobby with him. Rada was at the desk and as soon as she saw me, she smiled and greeted me by name. The amazing thing is, the last time she saw me was April! She always goes out of her way to make me and my coworkers feel welcome, saying hello and greeting us by name. She's working in the right industry and The Sheraton should make sure they hold onto her. The hotel is conveniently located, the beds are comfortable and the bar has decent food and the price was right for a stay downtown. Nothing fancy, but certainly clean and comfortable. There is a fitness room (small). The only problem I ran into was during a visit in early April. My room got a bit stuffy and I was unable to get AC (The hotel explained that due to the type of heating/cooling system they had, they could set it on heat OR cool - and based on the outside temp, it was on heat). I would go back and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Two-Star Experience, Five-Star Price”
Reviews.Author: SuperGuido
Reviews.Content: There were a ridiculous number of things that could be better at this particular Sheraton. While the hotel is downtown, the area around it is not all that desirable while other hotels are all grouped together near the convention center. For almost $200 a night, there was no shuttle from the airport or service of any kind aside from city-supplied transport. The pool was out of towels more often than not and on the fourth day our room wasn't even tidied up, though the trash was emptied which made no sense. No food was offered in the price and the business center was attached to the bar so it wasn't exactly quiet. The Fitness room was a tiny closet-sized space in the lower level of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: JerryH_10
Reviews.Content: The staff friendly and helpful, needs upgrading, but it was comfortable. I would return because while not luxurious a good value for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dfgdave
Reviews.Content: I have done a fair amount of personal and business travel lately and have been fortunate to get one winner of a hotel after another. I was in Indy on business and chose this hotel because it is convenient to the convention center. Also, I stayed there six years ago and liked it. It's still a likeable hotel. Just off monument circle in a relatively quiet area. The lobby was inviting, the front desk staff acommodating and the bar tenders very friendly. The room was very clean, the beds comfortable and the Sheraton bath ammenities very nice. Everything you would want in a good hotel. I usually book all of my hotels directly with the hotel, not a travel site, but this time went through Travelocity since the hotel site listed no rooms available on their site. Treatment was no different by going through a third party. I like the Sheraton properties and wil be staying here next year. Good job, Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Came for location to Lucas Oil Stadium, and would come back again!”
Reviews.Author: SEAN09GRANGER
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful and we had a nice one night stay. The beds are wonderful...slept so well!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: ghank45
Reviews.Content: Long flight time from the West Coast. Lucy Devi, the night manager, greeted me and is just the best. Great personality, pretty eyes, very efficient and just made me feel relaxed that I was "home". The room was clean, comfortable and luxuriously appointed with a large flat screen and nice work desk. I was on a business trip. The Club lounge complimentary breakfast and evening wine and hors d'oeuvre was excellent. Very nice wait staff. They recommended Nicky Blaines, just down the street from the hotel. Go see Ben, Bartender of the year. He makes a killer Mojito, almost as good as I make. The Hotel is centrally located downtown so I had short trips to the offices I intended to visit. Got a ride back to the airport in a Town Car. Just a really nice and relaxing visit. Be sure to stay at this hotel and say hi to Luci. You'll love her.

Reviews.Title: “Room was good, but elevator was slow”
Reviews.Author: christens02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton while attending an event at Lucas Oil Stadium. It's not that long a walk back to the hotel from the stadium, but be prepared for a hike. I don't know if the hotel was particularly busy that weekend, but it seemed that every time we wanted to get into an elevator and go up or down, we waited for what seemed like an extended period of time. I was a bit puzzled by the bathroom. Usually, at a Sheraton, I am expecting a toilet with a tank. This toilet was more like I found at the stadium with lots of exposed pipes. The water pressure was fine, but it took quite a while to get hot water in the shower. There was hot water quickly in the sink right next to it, however, which just struck me as being strange. The staff was very friendly, except for the person at the desk at midnight when we got back to the hotel who sold me tuna and crackers from the sundries shop. She seemed either overworked or overwrought. The room was very clean. I really want to give this hotel 3.5 stars, because it was better than average, but there were just these few things that really bugged me. I probably would have been more annoyed at these items, but we got such a great deal on the room that we did get our money's worth. I would probably stay here again, but I don't know that it would be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: Barbara C
Reviews.Content: I couldn't ask for more, Before I got to Indianapolis, Ethel from the Sheraton made sure I had a beautiful room. It was amazing, overlooking Monument Square and the pool and on the 12th floor. I was one happy camper. I could work hard all day at the Conference knowing I had a really fabulous room to come back to. Thank you Ethel and thank you Sheraton Indianapolis for encouraging this kind of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay in downtown Indy!”
Reviews.Author: TonyaLeS
Reviews.Content: Super clean room, comfortable bedding, nice rooftop pool and one of the best places to stay in downtown Indy that's close to everything! Wish a continental breakfast was included but it's also easy to eat there or walk to LePeep's for breakfast! Highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go when it's hot”
Reviews.Author: frequentdiner27
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel in the center of Indy to stay in after a dinner with customers and spouses. Chose the Sheraton since they're usually upscale at a resonable price. WOW - Couldn't get the room cooled down, even after setting thermostat at 65. Lobby was probably low 80's (outside was high 90's). Had a drink in the lobby bar after dinner, and couldn't stand sitting there - too hot. I guess the waitress couldn't either since it was hard to get her to pay the bill. Other than the heat, the tooms were fine - clean, good shower. I expected much more from a Sheraton. Parking is expensive, and they've cut staff, so hard to get someone to valet park the car, or pick it up in the morning. Won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is decent but has drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: luvvaca020
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a couple of days while on a business trip. I selected the hotel because it was fairly close to the airport. The rooms are average size and will meet basic needs. The front desk employees were friendly and helpful. There is a full Starbucks on site and prices are average for Starbucks. I had dinner at the Restaurant on site and it was quite expensive. I got a salad and an entree of Salmon. The total of the bill (no alcohol) was around 43.00 without a tip. While it was good, it wasn't that good. There are lots of places to eat within a walkable distance. The hotel has free wifi in the lobby but charges in the room (I believe it was $25 for 24 hours). The hotel lobby and hallways are very hot in July which was very frustrating when it was 100 Degrees with 100% humidity. The room was fairly comfortable in that regard. They have garage parking and if I remember correctly the parking is also $25 for 24 hours. I didn't care for the set up of the garage and how you get from the garage to the hotel. As a single female, I was uncomfortable waiting for the elevator. They should offer valet especially when you pay so much to park there. A co-worker was staying at The Hyatt which is just a block or two away and that hotel was heads and tails above The Sheraton in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...good views”
Reviews.Author: Chief4ever
Reviews.Content: This was a serviceable hotel with very good views of the monument circle (which was closed off while we were there). Good service and clean. Only issue was with the Cooling system, we cranked it all the way downa dn it still didn't get overly cold. other than that, we had no issues with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An oldie but a goodie!”
Reviews.Author: Geekontherun
Reviews.Content: I have to tell you I am not a fan of Sheraton hotels in general but this one could change my mind. I stayed at this hotel 20 plus years ago and recently stayed again on business. I realized this when I checked in. The hotel has been re-done inside (don't panic!) It is not dingy or have an old feel to it. The hotel staff was wonderful. They were fast to respond and VERY pleasant and accommodating! I was shocked my room service was delivered by the head chef. The food was delicious and hot. The sleep was VERY relaxing and restful. I highly recommend this hotel and WILL stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not Terrible. Then I Killed a Roach the Size of My Thumb.”
Reviews.Author: GlennCT
Reviews.Content: Let it be known that I don't believe in bashing any business unfairly, and I'm not that hard to please. That said, I'd never go back to this hotel again. I just spent a week there with a convention and here's the low-down... The best feature of this hotel is its location, right in the heart of downtown Indy. Everything seems to be nearby or within a distance of short walk. I also found the staff to be pleasant (if not exceptionally outgoing) and efficient. And, at first glance, the hotel seems to be up to par... but after a short period of time the cracks start to show. First off, parking and the hotel's restaurant are ridiculously overpriced. $30 for a breakfast for two, and $23/day to park? Come on. This is Indianapolis, not midtown Manhattan. More importantly, the place could definitely use some sprucing up. While the main public areas and room would rate as average in my book, the parking garage and adjoining lobby areas are depressingly dingy, as is the not-changed-in-the-slightest-since-the-60's pool area. I would have said that the overall cleanliness of the hotel was on-par, if not for the visitor I encountered on day four. On my way out the door, there, right above the door handle on the door frame, was a perfect, 3-inch-long specimen of the all-American cockroach. Now folks, I live in the NYC Metro area, so I know a roach when I see one. And this guy was a whopper by even New york standards. Some may argue that any building can get cockroaches. I'll argue back that I don't want to spend $129/night to stay in one of them. In all fairness, I did report the sighting (and subsquent killing on my behalf) of this visitor and the hotel did make a monetary adjustment to my bill. For that, they get a two instead of a one-dot rating... at least they tried. But I still have the willies. Yecch.

Reviews.Title: “Very successful business event!!! I am so happy!”
Reviews.Author: westshorebass
Reviews.Content: I am blown away by this Hotel's amazing customer service, especially Kara Sorenson. She IS the most single-handed nicest, genuine, hardest manager I've ever spoken to. I needed to book a conference room for my business meeting with little notice and she was my savior, she took care of EVERYTHING PERFECTLY!!! Best hotel I've ever worked with. Period. - Chris Stark

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyingT-Rex
Reviews.Content: I liked the Sheraton City Centre. Having never been to Indianapolis, the location is great. My room was on the back side of the hotel (relative to the entrance) and had a beautiful view of Monument Circle and its fountains. (the front faces office buildings) The rooms were very nice and the hotel was quiet and peaceful for a downtown hotel. Sometimes downtown hotels are bustling with conferences, but this one seemed more low key than normal. One minor thing to be aware of...the entire downtown area had a significant number of homeless people. Be braced for a little non-agressive pan-handling on many street corners if you get out and walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great Service, great value”
Reviews.Author: StElmoChatt
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 5 or 6 times in the last year and three times in the past few weeks. The staff and location are excellent. and ready to help with anything. Really nice people. Location is great - I've walked from here to all the monuments, conseco fieldhouse, park, canals, etc. The rooms are standard-issue - nothing fancy. Same with the pool, except for the view is great. However, the Sheraton Club is much better than a usual club. It's worth paying a little extra.

Reviews.Title: “Super room!”
Reviews.Author: sdstdriver
Reviews.Content: Gamze was the person who checked me in and she gave me a fabulous room!! 1501--great view of the Monument and the Circle, day and night. I was so happy. All the staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful. I walked to restaurants. I also left my WEN hair care products and Yvette was instrumental and nice about helping me get them back. Once I called about them and, although I got voicemail at Housekeeping, Spenser at the front desk was so helpful and kind as well. I thought it was odd that I would have had to pay for Internet conectivity in my room, and I couldn't even Mapquest downstairs in the very nice Business area.

Reviews.Title: “Run down and in need of spiffing up.”
Reviews.Author: mikaln
Reviews.Content: The people who run the hotel are very nice, and they're service-oriented. However, this hotel was built in the late 60s, therefore it lacks the charm of an older building, and the drama of a newer one. The entrance from the parking garage is particularly gruesome. The state of the elevator lobby there feels like you've maybe been transported to the parking garage of a bus station, not a nice hotel. What a way to make a first impression. (That, and the lock on the door to the elevator lobby that's supposed to work with a swipe of your room key, but is broken and open to anybody. Nice security.) On the plus side, the location is hard to beat in downtown Indianapolis. Long hallways with low ceilings, windows that don't open to let in fresh air, not much to look forward to here. Strictly standard-issue (or maybe slightly below.)

Reviews.Title: “VERY UNDERSTANDING AND HELPFUL”
Reviews.Author: Stan1136
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife and two other couples had made reservations for the Sheraton City Center, however our friend had made them for the one at the fashion mall. The young lady at the front desk helped us to cancel the wrong one and got us 3 rooms there. Great Job!! We took our lugage up to our rooms and headed over to the Wine Festival. We had not been there for more than an hour when we got a call from my sister-in-law that my wifes mother had a massive stroke. We returned to the hotel and the same young lady that had helped us before took excellent care of us. She called the manager and we were not charged for the room. We arrived home and all her children got to sleep at the foot of her of her chair that nite. Unfortunately she passed that next day. I stay in Indianapolis at least once a month and will stay no where else but the Sheraton City Center. What Great People you have at your hotel!! God Bless You All!!

Reviews.Title: “Close proimity to downtown”
Reviews.Author: Hoosiers48
Reviews.Content: Like the room fine. Good service from staff. Good location. Think it is tacky the way they have the fence area by the street blocked off at the pool. They have done it with "warning" tape. They need to put up an iron fence close in and put up some fake trees. To pay $23 a night to park is excessive. Gives you the feeling of being ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: jbp19
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel several times for the Indianapolis 500, including the last four nights for the 2011 race. The location is within walking distance of several restaurants and attractions in downtown Indianapolis. If you're coming to Indy for the 500, the location is great since the 500 festival parade passes next to the hotel on Meridian (we could have watched the parade from our room), and shuttle buses from downtown to the track leave from a few blocks away. The hotel rooms are large, have great views of Monument Circle, and the front desk staff is always helpful. There is internet access available in rooms, but wifi is only available in the lobby. Other than that, it's a great option for staying in downtown Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING .... STAY AWAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KyMoonTraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are dated, smell bad and MOLDY and the staff are rude!!! Also our reservation was not fulfilled as made and absolutely ruined our trip. To make it worse they didn't even care or offer to make it right. STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!! Do not believe their response as they will try to make excuses and explain it away!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great except for room!”
Reviews.Author: gmetteta
Reviews.Content: Most of it was great! The conference center was good. The food for the conference was great. But we had a major problem with the room. The air conditioner dripped water onto the floor at the door. We called and they (supposedly) fixed. It got worse! We called again, but nothing was done. We had to put two garbage cans next to the door when we were there ( and they filled up through the night.) It was loud enough to be heard over my white noise machine and keep me awake. When we were out of the room, it just soaked into the carpet. Gross! We reported it again as we checked out and he just said "thank you for letting us know.". The problem could occur to any hotel, but we were very disappointed in their lack of response.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - perfect service”
Reviews.Author: kenji27
Reviews.Content: Arrival: Very smooth, I took the IndyGo Green line service which takes you delivered in around 30 min direct infront of the entrance for $7. walk from hotel to malls, city center and convention center only one block. Reservation was set correct, already upgraded to a suite room as Platinum benefit. Room: I have got a two room suite, nicely decorated, microwave and kitchenette. I guess it was newly renovated. the luaggage room is a bit tiny if you travel with the spouse, but there are pleanty options to leave your stuff. The hotel takes part on the green choice program, so I declined housekeeping for one night. We will see if I will get some points for it (many others complained in other properties that no points or credit have been posted so far). Breakfast: took the buffet at circles cafe, it was ok. several other a la card options of hot stuff where available on reasonable prices around $10. I have got access for continental bf at the sheraton club lounge, but they finish at 9 am, so I took the restaurant where bf is available until 10:30am. Sheraton Club: I have got club acces as Platinum benefit. I have to say for non-elite members an upsell to club is worth the money. very nice design (singapore style), 2 big plasma tv, free internet access (very good speed), continental bf, hors d'oevre featuring a hot selection, salad and snacks, cheese selection and californian wine tasting containing around 10 selection of red, white and rose wine - free of charge! I think most *wood properties in the US charge even in club for drinks (this is an typical american thing), but not at sheraton dt indi. Overall experience: very nice and smooth, very good service for the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Day Blues”
Reviews.Author: adriannecoplen
Reviews.Content: I booked a block of rooms 2 months before my wedding at the downtown Indianapolis, Sheraton. When we arrived around 10:30 PM, along with the maid of honor, her date, and two other groups of people who had rooms reserved we were told they had overbooked and we would have to stay somewhere else. "John Doe", who I booked my rooms with promised me we would have no problem with our check in. Imagine my embarrassment when we arrive and none of us have rooms? They managed to find a room for me the bride, but my maid of honor was sent elsewhere along with some other friends. These people had made reservations so I am still confused how you can overbook? Our room was free, but nothing can replace the embarrassment I felt. To make matters worse the hotel where they sent my friends charged them for their rooms! Sheraton said they would be payng for them? We are still trying to figure this out and my wedding was 2/19/11. I have called "John Doe", but didn't even get an apology. He said we paid for your room and theirs, you should be happy with that?! Are you kidding me? We didn't mind paying for our rooms in the first place, as long as we were all going to be staying in the same place. This has left a horrible taste in my mouth and I hope they can fix their customer service issues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in all ways imaginable. Great value, price, location, etc.”
Reviews.Author: Westondrive
Reviews.Content: I am a starwood platinum member and travel almost 200 nights a year - this Sheraton hotel has an excellent club lounge. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again and again. All the staff were friendly and courteous. When in Indianapolis this is my #1 hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location good but, hotel is only average.”
Reviews.Author: mother52
Reviews.Content: Computer system is terrible. It took me 20 minutes to print my boarding pass. Three out of four computer systems were 'stuck' or very slow. There was no one 'available' to help. To make things worse, the business center was in the BAR!!!!! I have never seen such a thing. BAD IDEA!!! Additionally, the internet in the room DID NOT WORK. After 40 minutes of trying to get it to work, I called 'technical support'. He did not help. He suggested to 'replace the cable'. Front desk sent up a 'cable' that was too short. Terribly experience.

Reviews.Title: “Thin Walls and Unadvertised Internet Site Blocking”
Reviews.Author: HardToughPlay
Reviews.Content: Standard room at a Sheraton. But walls are thin and I heard my neighbors on both sides. By 'heard' I mean bathroom activities, snoring, and just about everything else. This hotel also restricts their internet sites, so if you need access to site they find 'morally' dangerous to their network, they are blocked. There are NO notices or information about which site are block, nor that they even do it. My formal complaint was responded to timely, but I was told to basically 'deal with it'. I will never stay here again, despite being a loyal Starwood member.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: StElmoChatt
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel and they took care of us well. I was travelling with my wife and three children. We requested a suite in a quiet area of the hotel. We never heard a peep and everybody slept well. Considering the Colts/Jets game was going on and the hotel was sold out, I was pretty impressed. I was expecting rowdy drunken fans all night, but wherever they put us was nice and quiet. Location is nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms good, suites terrible”
Reviews.Author: JoGelke
Reviews.Content: I opted to review this hotel again after a recent stay for Christmas. I can only recommend to stay in a regular (updated) room and stay away from the suites. First of all, for some very strange reason, the suites do not have a view of the beautiful Monument Circle. Secondly, the suites have obviously not been updated...it is almost like being in a different hotel. The hallway was extremely hot and when we got to our room and got everything set up to host a couple of friends, we discovered that the tv did not work. We summoned help to discover that we had to change rooms and EVERYTHING had to be moved including the appitizers and bar we had already set up. Our next room was so hot that we asked for the air conditioner to be turned on - it couldn't be so they told us to open the curtains and the room would cool down as it was very cold outside. The suite rooms are outdated and worn (in contrast to the nice regular rooms I stayed in previously). The hotel did compensate with $30 off but a Hampton In would have given the room for free..... I wasted points.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and locations; Great staff”
Reviews.Author: de1996
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for the first time. The hotel is definately worth a recommendation. Very friendly and supportive staff, Starbucks in the lobby. The rooms are nice, clean, and the bed is the SPG comfort setting. Definately a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “INTERNET CENSORSHIP. Let adults make their own web choices w/o blocks”
Reviews.Author: NYCTravelingMan2010
Reviews.Content: Staying here for business. This hotel has blocked access generally to many, many websites that it deems are "inappropriate." Despite repeated calls to the front desk, there is no override. While I completely respect the need for parents to restrict internet access to their child travelers, the solution to that is for the hotel to allow parents to opt to block aspect sof the web. Adult travelers who present ID at check-in should not be subject to the hotel's judgment as to what what websites an adult may access. I am not a sick pervert, but when traveling, I ought to be able to make my own internet choices. I'm an adult. Treat me like one. Is this an Indiana Bible Belt policy, or a Starwood policy? If the former, one more reason to dislike the conservative Hoosier State. If the latter, one more reason to stay at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Yes!”
Reviews.Author: AgingWanderer
Reviews.Content: Like the idea of hearing the woman in the next room screaming in ecstasy at 6:30 p.m. on a Thursday night? Stay here and it may happen to you! It did to us... First, our room was billed to the wrong credit card. It was supposed to go on a corporate card (on which the room was reserved) but two nights and the parking to go alomg with it was charged to a personal card presented for incidentals... this despite calls and faxes and xeroxes presented at check-in. It took from morning to evening with several calls to our credit card company to straighten out the mess. THEN came the woman in the next room! We wanted to scream! Calls to the room from the front desk to the frisky parties in question went unanswered and the loud sex continued. It took a second visit to the front desk but we got a room change. We packed in a hurry and moved our bags and now almost 8 p.m. went in search of food. When we returned at 9:45 we discovered the $11.95/night ethernet cable needing Internet connection was NOT working in our new, quieter room. Now pulling out hair, what little is left! It took three hours and replacement of cables and modem by a member of the hotel's engineering staff to discover... we were out of luck. None of the fixes worked. After the guy left I noticed by the phone on the nightstand wires coming out from BEHIND the phone's wall plate that led to what must have been a 30-foot long ethernet cable stuffed underneath one of the two double beds in the room. I untangled it and stretched it across the room and plugged it into the laptop's port and Voila! The fee got comped for both nights, thank God. If you can, find another hotel that has joined the 21st Century and has FREE Internet via WIFI and not a freakin' cable! Anything good to say, you ask? Rada at the front desk. What hotel service should always be. Views of Monument Circle, especially at night decked out for the holidays... but you might get this from another hotel on the circle, or just get outside and see it up close and personal. In-room Starbucks. That's all worth mentioning, in that order. Did I mention what an asset Rada is to Starwood Hotels? Staying in a downtown, high-rise hotel shouldn't be a crapshoot. I'm sure not everyone will have a nightmare experience like we did (though now would be a good place to mention that we overheard another guest complaining that someone who should nothave a key card to her room was successfully unlocking her door at 12:30 a.m.). Like to gamble with your hotel? Stay here. Rather play it safe? Don't.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: It's oh kay. Nice that it's off the Circle, but in the tiny downtown of Indy, there happens to be very little to eat right around there. There's a lot more near the Marriott/JW Marriott... Rooms are oh kay. Kinda old and kinda updated. Staff are super nice. Good bartender and front desk folks. Outdoor pool is a big disappoint in a city that's often cold. Prices aren't too bad. I bet you could Priceline and get this joint cheap. I'd recommend because Starwood staff are always well-trained and will be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: cdpils
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in the center of Indianapolis and my room had great views on Monumentum Circle. The room was spacey, well maintained and good equipped. Unfortunatly walls seem to be very thin, therefore it was really noisy all night, which made it difficult to sleep. WLAN was only available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Yearly visit”
Reviews.Author: wheretonext24
Reviews.Content: Have visited the hotel for the last few years now for motorcycle racing events. This place is always great to stay at and have great staff there. Have very nice tv's and nice views of the city. Looking forward to our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: bookandcoffee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton City Center last weekend for him to attend a conference...I tagged along as I had never been to Indy before. The lobby was spacious and attractive, with several comfortable chairs both alone and in groups (which was important since the free wifi could only be used in the lobby). The desk staff was overwhelmed with so many people checking in at the same time, but despite the lines, they remained cheerful and helpful. As we checked in, I jokingly asked if they would like to give us the honeymoon suite for the same price as the room we had booked, and was amazed when our clerk searched and did upgrade us to a suite for the same price! Our suite was great! Large, spacious rooms on the 20th floor, attractively decorated . The living area had a comfortable chair and sofa and large flatscreen TV with HD satellite channels, and a wetbar with microwave and small fridge and coffeemaker with Starbucks coffee. Large double doors closed off the bedroom, which had a very comfortable king sized bed, another chair with ottoman, desk, and TV. The bath area featured a huge vanity in the bedroom and another smaller sink and vanity in the tub area. One thing I really appreciated was the lighting----the vanity lights were bright and their were lamps everywhere you would want them----something that is often skimped on in hotels. I hate a dark room, or one where you can't read because the lamps are too dim or not where you want them. The location was perfect for exploring downtown---just a block away from monument circle, a few blocks from the capital and museums, with restaurants and shopping all close enough that we did not move the car once we checked in. On the business side, my husband reported that the conference rooms were comfortable and easily accomodated the large number of people and various meetings that were being help with his convention. The only negative comments I have are that the free wifi was only available in the lobby, not in the room, and that it was not working for most of our stay. Also, we could hear a lot of street noise in our room----sirens, horns, etc. And, we had to pay $23 a night for parking in the garage. But, we had a great stay, and highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel staff, great location. Good for business travel”
Reviews.Author: teaseicu
Reviews.Content: This review is the culmination of over 75 nights spend in the last year at this location. The business manager developed a terrific deal for our project team which traveled into town each week Mon-Thurs. I earned Plat. status while at the hotel, but have to admit that I was treated as a Plat. member all along. Sure, this hotel doesn't match up to the likes of the Conrad, but that's not it's purpose. If you want an exceptional staff, that knows who you are, by name upon arrival, who will do their very best to make your stay the best Sheraton stay they can, then this hotel is a good option. The lounge was recently renovated and is nicely appointed and has what you would expect from a Sheraton. While I do think that some of the floors and rooms could use some updating, the rooms are well maintained by the staff. (Perhaps this Sheraton is on the list for future renovation?) The key is to get to know the staff, feel free to try to negotiate, as my team had the promise of 10+ rooms for a number of months - you'll be surprised what *wood will do to keep your stays in house. I have to say, the hospitality here is better than the Westin in my experience. The Sheraton staff went above and beyond, whereas the Westin simple treated you like any old guest (in my experience) - and I'm not one to seek out pampering, or expect it. If you find the need to stay in Indy and are looking for value and service. I strongly recommend the Sheraton Indianapolis City Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: DKline56
Reviews.Content: A couple of buddies and I flew to Indy to watch the Giants/Colts game last weekend. It would be easy to leave talking badly about Indy (what can I say, I'm a Giants fan), but the fact of the matter is our stay at the Sheraton was incredible. When we arrived the 2 young ladies at the front desk were amazing. The Manager helping us was named "Rada" (apparently from Maldova). She was extremely bright eyed and cheery when she greeted us and extremely personable as well. There were 2 weddings going on that evening and she was interrpted a few times during the check in process. She apologized for the interruptions (although it really wasn't a big deal) and then upgraded our rooms to suites for being so nice (I guess NOT yelling at someone in the service industry is considered nice). This interaction defined the rest of our stay. Everyone we dealt with went out of their way to make us feel at home. The room was immaculate, breakfast was great and the Starbucks downstairs was perfect. Everthing about the stay exceeded expectations (except the Giants getting killed).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a few small flaws.”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveler68
Reviews.Content: This Hotel's location was perfect , right in the center of the city. The room was outstanding, and the view was fantastic. I highly recommend the breakfast buffet, even though it was a little expensive at $12.00. My only real complaints are that the hotel restaurants and bars close very early. Also, the internet service never worked in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of inconveniences here!”
Reviews.Author: acmarek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently on a business trip and was not all that satisfied with it for the price point. One of my main frustrations was that in my two-day stay, the Internet service went out several times, making it difficult after long days of being out in the field for me to do file reports to my boss. The hotel also lacked a minibar in the room, had room service that closed fairly early (11 pm), and was in an area where almost nothing was open late at night if you needed a snack. My room was clean, and the staff seemed friendly. Still though, even my expense report from this hotel is going to be an issue: They changed the name on my reservation to my husband's name because he is the primary person associated with our Starwood Rewards account.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but tiny with parking issues.”
Reviews.Author: daysgoby
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 of my friends traveled to Indianapolis to see Keith Urban play at the Indiana State Fair. We arrived late on Friday night and when checking in the receptionist was not very friendly; turned out she worked all weekend and was never really friendly throughout the weekend either. We parked in the parking garage connected to the hotel, which had numerous spaces available and was well lit and felt secure. When we got to our room it was not quite what we expected. It was clean, which is always a plus, but it was VERY small. The air conditioner in the room was not working properly all weekend. We turned it down to 60 on Friday night and it was still a little warm in there throughout the night. By Saturday night we had the a/c down to 53 and on high and the room was still not very cool. We called the manager and he did bring us 2 fans to help with the cooling issues. Here is my biggest gripe about the hotel...parking. When we left the parking garage on Saturday afternoon it was a nightmare. I put in my ticket to leave the garage and the gate would not lift so we had to wait until an attendant came out. The attendant informed us that as a guest of the hotel you need to get the parking ticket validated at the front desk, which we were not informed about when we checked in. Once it was validated we went in and out with ease. On Saturday night when leaving for the concert we were in a line of about 15 cars trying to get out of the parking garage. A friend walked up to the front and informed the people who were trying to get out that they had to go in and get their ticket validated to get out. Just like us they were not informed of this either. All in all the hotel was okay. I will not stay there again, but the room and hotel itself were clean if that is what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: JoGelke
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel alone on a Saturday night and had a very pleasant experience. I never felt afraid for being alone and I thought the rooms were very nice. I used Starwood points and thought it was a great value! I had a great view of the monument on the circle.

Reviews.Title: “kyle etter in valet service went above and beyond the call of duty”
Reviews.Author: schlanettie
Reviews.Content: Mr. Etter should be awarded outstanding service award. He valet my car and my family and I went to a local restaurant called Peeps. We had rather a large group. It began to rain and he came down to our restaurant and brought us unbrellas and also had a taxi waiting for those that perferred to ride. What a great help. He was thinking ahead. He also suggested a restaurant to eat at in which we should have taken his advise. Peeps wasn't good in service or food. Thank you Kyle for doing such a great job.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Amanda37315
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I didn't get a chance to say good-bye or thankyou, to the two valet gentlemen who were great, and helpful, and funny. To Travis and Kyle, my Husband and I say thankyou for everything and were sorry we missed you. Keep up the good work, and hope to see you both again soon. Sincerely, Amanda and Scott ( room 1819) incase you forgot. Take care Guys. You both were GREAT

Reviews.Title: “Good Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: admit_it
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very interesting. The lobby is great - but once you step onto the elevator to find your room you will be very confused. The hotel starts 6-8 floors up beyond the lobby - as the parking garage is floors 2-7 - and the elevator is shared between the hotel and the lobby. By American hotel standards - this hotel is very old - I would imagine it was built in the early 60's - possibly even the late 50's. After the elevator confusion - you step out into very cramped, dated and dirty elevator lobbies. The corridors at this hotel are about 10 years overdue for renovation, they smell musty - and I would never walk barefoot on the carpet. Once again - something interesting - I stepped into my room and it was clean, fresh, updated, and very comfortable. I was actually upgraded to a suite with two rooms, wet-bar, and two sinks - one in a room with the shower, and then one in the bedroom. The rooms have a very masculine decor which was actually a great change from the typically all white and sterile look of most modern hotels. All in all the hotel is nice, not one of the best out there - but since i was staying here for a conference I didn't have a choice of hotels- but I would stay here again. If they would just replace the elevators, and update the corridors, this hotel would be top notch! It is in a great location in downtown - very easy to walk nearly anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: nothappybc
Reviews.Content: reserved 1 room through the mini 500 marathon festival site. We figured this was a recommended hotel and close to location. Every encounter with hotel staff was met with rudeness and poor service. We had n idea the parking garage would be so small that our standard F250 would not fit into the parking ramp. We asked the door man and reception desk staff for assistance and they had no advice. There answer was to shrug their shoulders. We ended up parking 10 blocks away and left our truck in a not very nice neighborhood. It was not a relaxing stay. Our friends were charged approximately 27$ just to park. This is not information shared when you make the reservation. Then 1 month after our stay, the credit card bill comes and they charged us 2 nights. When we called them, they said well that weekend was a 2 night minimum stay. I always thought that had to be disclosed a head of time.

Reviews.Title: “Nephews Wedding June 5th”
Reviews.Author: Hooch0164
Reviews.Content: My nephew was married at the War Memorial. But our wedding party stayed with you! It was wonderful, I own a Resort at Indiana Beach, so I am aware of hospitality. It was SUPER. Everyone was very helpful, rooms were clean and updated. I stay in Indianapolis several times a year but never at the Sheraton. But from now on, my place to stay will be there. Thank You Robyn Royer

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for location, view and service.”
Reviews.Author: LisaWithrow
Reviews.Content: I have stayed her on business on 4 occasions since January, 2010. The view of the city is gorgeous, the rooms are clean, the beds are VERY comfortable, the staff is exceptional. Easy walking distance to all government buildings for work/training purposes. All rooms have a very large, flat-screen HDTV. Parking is expensive and hard to find in downtown Indianapolis but I can leave my car on check-out day until after 5pm. There are excellent restaurants within blocks. I feel safe and well cared for when staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great View of the City, Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: lovepeacejoynj
Reviews.Content: We live in Indianapolis, so this stay was at the last second while taking a stroll in the downtown. I just walked in to the hotel lobby and talked to a customer service rep Viktoria, who was very helpful and pleasing in getting us the best of the hotel rooms with a view of the monument circle and also getting us all the complementary supplies since we did not have any. All in all, the cleanliness, the View and staff was very good, including Helen at the Breakfast Cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: DaveySF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the city center with great views of the war memorial and just a few blocks from the City Center Mall - the perfect location for travelers without a rental car. Unlike other Sheratons, this Sheraton charges for in-room internet access, but wi-fi is free in the hotel lobby and there's a Starbuck located in the hotel lobby with free wi-fi. As a basic SPG (frequent user/customer), I was greeted with a bag of goodies (bottle of water and a couple of sweet treats) upon check-in. Rooms are nice and big with all the amenities. Rates are very reasonable and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Missy8331
Reviews.Content: I must say this is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in!!! We stayed here for a Friend's Birthday and enjoyed a relaxing time. The pool area is breathtaking, it overlooks the city. The room had the look of a luxury hotel, without paying the high price!!! I highly recommend this hotel over any other in the Indianapolis area. It is centrally located next to all the bars and entertainment!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average”
Reviews.Author: cliff_rock
Reviews.Content: This is an old-school Sheraton. They've put some effort into cleaning up the common areas and the rooms, but the old shell remains. For example, really no closet in the room (instead an armoire), older windows, old metal interior doors, older shower tile/fixtures. On the other had, brand new flat screen TV and the Ralph Lauren theme room decor. Bottom line, a mixed bag. Good central location directly on the downtown circle. The outdoor pool overlooks the cricle monument. I visited during an auto race weekend, so the hotel was quite busy though they did a good job servicing guests. Club lounge does not offer weekend service, though it is open as a gathering spot for eligible guests.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: lanative13
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights at the hotel for a conference at another Indianapolis hotel. It did the job - clean, friendly staff, nice club floor (hallways weren't that nice, but rooms and club room were well appointed). The gym was clean and had flat panel t.v.'s.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth full price.”
Reviews.Author: kyl33t
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend for my wedding (we stayed with family here and got ready and did our pictures downtown, and had the wedding on the south side of Indy). It's a nice hotel, but pricey. Parking is $23 self-park, $25 for valet daily to begin with. We got the room for $80/night on Hotwire, but the regular rates are over $200. The rooms are pretty tiny with standard sized bathrooms. The beds are comfortable. The rooms are either way hot or way cold as usual. The view was pretty cool though. The service was nice until we left and had problems with random charges on our room, then the ladies on the phone were gruff and mean. The location is awesome and within walking distance of nearly everything - very cool staying right on the circle. My family from the boonies of Michigan seemed impressed. It was clean and nice, but very pricey for everything from internet to the crappy buffet breakfast ($12 for hard eggs). And $5 bottled water in the room. Lovely! Starbucks is in the lobby though which was nice. Overall, it worked out great for our needs and the price we got, but I wouldn't stay at this hotel again since it's way overpriced for what you get, and the service we got while trying to fix charges on the phone was less than helpful. I would recommend it to people ONLY if they booked through a site like Hotwire and got a deal, and wanted a downtown experience. Otherwise, the Holiday Inn Express offered the same kind of amenities and more exceptional service for less.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovation. Too bad the AC doesn't work.”
Reviews.Author: qwerty123089
Reviews.Content: I am sitting in my room sweating as I type this. It's warm outside and the AC in my room has been cranking full blast since I arrived to no avail. It's blowing out room temperture air, about 75 degrees, I'd say, even though I have it set to 50, now, in an attempt to cool it off in here. Room service overcharged me. The menu said 99 cents for a soda. They charged me $3, quite a difference. The front desk had my reservation screwed up. I had booked a special rate where your second night is equal to your birth year. The clerk couldn't figure out how to do it. The rooms are tiny, too. The front desk clerk barely spoke to me, even though I was the only guest checking in for miles. She could have at least smiled or acknowledged my existence. Ahhhhhhhh!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Almost a perfect stay... but a lot went wrong!”
Reviews.Author: MsAdie
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival one of the two rooms we booked was not ready, even though we arrived late for check in. The personnel were very friendly and accommodating in view of this. When we went up to the room it was very well cleaned, so we were pleased. We called to request a refrigerator and one came within 10 minutes. Every need we had, and in view of it being a busy weekend because of the basketball tournament, they met speedily. That evening however when going up to our room, myself and my cousin had the elevator break down with us in it! We had to wait an hour and a half for maintenance to arrive and open the doors. The second mishap was the fact that we had neighbors that thought we talked to loud. Keep in mind, there was no party, no music, in fact we didn't even watch TV! They called the front desk and had someone come knock on our door, then they proceeded to bang on our wall, then lastly they slipped a nasty note under our door. It really put a damper on our socializing.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: onestroke
Reviews.Content: I think this Sheraton hotel is a very good price for the quality that you receive. The room was in very good condition and very clean. I was very impressed with the staff that seemed to be everywhere. They were very accommodating and friendly. I thought that the hotel was perfectly located in the downtown area. I never used a taxi or rented a car because I was within walking distance to everything downtown (mall, restaurants, museums, and more). There is a Starbucks connected to the lobby of the hotel. There is also Starbucks in your room that you can make yourself, but not quite as good as the store brewed coffee. This is a full service hotel. One night I was looking to go get a bite to eat and it was raining. The bellhop immediately noticed I didn't have an umbrella and got one for me to use. He also gave me "drier" directions to get to the mall so I wouldn't get as wet. The bed was covered in nice crisp linens and was very comfortable. This is an older hotel that obviously has been renovated. I had one small complaint. The water temperature was not consistently hot when I took a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: outnumbrd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on SPG points for the Big Ten Tournament. Hotel staff was top notch! We had two suites that were right next to each other. Check-in was a breeze and the hotel was packed. TV's in one room didn't work, placed a call to the front desk within 5 minutes maintenance was up there and had the tv's running. Another time we needed more towels, called and they were promptly delivered. Needed a bellman for luggage - readily available. I cannot say enough about the staff at this hotel. They were extremely efficient and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Solid property for a city stay”
Reviews.Author: natjaye
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, walking distance to the capitol, bar area, city centre mall. Expect to pay for parking. Nice front desk staff and well appointed guest rooms, updated and clean. Flat screen TVs in both rooms of the suite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: explorepossibilities
Reviews.Content: I have to say I had higher expectations, but was satisfied overall. This was our first stay at a Sheraton, we always stay with Marriott. I chose this hotel because of the special rate and the pet policy. They allow pets under 40lbs free! We like to travel with our dog, but usually don’t due to the pet cleaning fee charged by most hotels. The room was nice enough, we were on the “Starwood Preferred Guest Level” which was nice. The floor we were on was VERY warm. I would not usually complain about this, but it was almost unbearable. The room was that warm too, we didn’t even have our heat on. The valet was EXCELLENT. Never been treated better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: machar
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a weeks stay at this hotel and it was wonderful. I was in town for a conference and was unable to stay in the conference hotel but this was just round the corner. To start from the beginning - a lovely welcome from the doormen when I arrived after 11 hours flying; check in was quick and professional but friendly and a parcel I had arranged to be sent to the hotel for me was handed over without me even having to ask for it. My room was on the 19th floor and the quick trip up in one of 4 elevators took no time at all. My room was spacious even with the 2 large beds and massive flatscreen TV. The view from my window was stunning - straight onto the Christmas lights of Monument Circle. Despite the extreme cold outside my room was lovely and warm and remained so throughout the entirety of my stay. As several other people have mentioned, yes you do have to pay for wired internet access in your room which I didn't fnd particularly surprising. I travel a great deal throughout Europe with work and often find that the cheaper hotels offer wireless internet for free and the more expensive hotels charge you for it. I paid $11.95 for 24 hours access which was very reasonable compared to some places I have stayed ($30 a day at a Hilton in the UK for example). I also used the business centre in the foyer where the wi-fi was free and there were 3 computers with free printing available as well. The wi-fi in the lobby was good as I used SKype there several times. It was a very relaxing lobby to work in as there were plenty of large leather seats and couches and I spent many an evening there relaxing! I ate in the hotel several times (breakfast x2; room service x1; restuarant x1) and the food was good. The breakfast buffet was nothing spectacular but was perfectly adequate and good value I thought at approx. $13.95. Plenty of non-guests seemed to come in for breakfast. The staff were all very courteous and helpful in particular the young doormen who were wonderful in getting me taxis, giving me directions and always having time for a quick chat. The hotel is perhaps slightly dated and this shows in the decor in the bathroom in particular. However the room furnishings themselves were absolutely fine and the bedding was wonderful - big soft pillows and plenty of blankets and duvets. I would quite happily go back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worth Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: Patriot27
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and overall had a great stay. Pros --- Great location and within walking distance to all major attractions including Lucas Oil Stadium. Room was very nicely appointed -- appears to have been recently renovated. Comfortable bed, nice work desk, and flat screen TV. Room had a great view of the city lights and Monument Circle! Ask for a room on the 9th floor or higher and for this view. The hotel is about a $25-30 cab ride with tip from the airport. There is a starbucks near the lobby area. Cons --- The bathroom was clean (most important) but was very small and didn't have the new feel of the rest of the room. Just before the front entrance of the hotel and the parking garage there is a bus stop that seems to be a gathering point for homeless and transients --- this might make some feel uncomfortable like it did to my colleague. Overall i had a great experience --- this is not the Conrad (down the street) but worth staying here and you'll end up paying a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: BoilerMakerBob
Reviews.Content: We always stay at a nice hotel downtown Indy to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Having read some of the previous reviews on this and other travel websites, we approached our stay with some apprehension. We saw none of the problems described by other reviewers. We experienced a first class hotel with a great staff. The room was spacious and comfortable with a wonderful view of the Soldier's & Sailor's Monument. Check in was seamless and quick. King bed was very comfortable. Hallways and public areas very nicely appointed - no low ceilings noted by other reviewers (I'm 6' 6" tall). Parking in attached garage was reasonable and felt secure. The only negative: After a walkabout in downtown Indy (the Sheraton is just one block north of the center of the city - great location), we decided to go to the pool. Using the hotel provided robes, we went to the pool. The pool was clean and clear but there was no shade whatever from the very bright sun. A few tables with market umbrellas would be nice. We would definitely return to the Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Fastco
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks in Indy, began with 2 nights at the Sheraton and ended with 1 night at Sheraton. Upon check in they could not find my booking made thru hotels.com, but no problem they had room. I found the room clean and comfy, the parking rate a little pricey ($22.00) per day, but loved the location. Walked to Colts game, downtown etc. For 2 days vehicle never left garage. Pool on the 9th floor with a view of Monument Circle well worth it. Speaking of the pool found out they allow thong swimwear as some dude was unbashed and enjoying the sun. For my last night there my room overlooked Monument Circle and slept with curtains parted to see the sights and had best sleep in two weeks. All the staff was very helpful and easy to deal with. Loved my time there and would repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, Poorly Maintained and Lacking in Knowledge”
Reviews.Author: WizarDru
Reviews.Content: We were very dissatisfied with the Sheraton City Centre in Indianapolis. While we appreciated being able to get a hotel room for the Gencon convention, if the next time we visit I have to choose between staying outside the city or this Sheraton, I will find a hotel that is distant. We encountered a variety of problems at the hotel from the moment we checked in on Wednesday evening right until the last minute we checked out on Monday morning. I have stayed at Sheraton hotels in the past and had generally positive experiences, but this experience left my family and I less likely to choose Sheratons in the future. Upon arrival, we were directed by hotel staff to the parking garage attached to the hotel. What we didn't realize was that the garage was $10 more per day than any garage in the area (including other nearby hotels and the garage 50 feet down the street) and that the hotel offered no discount for using it. We discovered that 'validation' was simply code for 'pay at the front desk', a nonsensical idea given that there was nowhere else to pay during most hours. It's unclear WHY the garage was so expensive, given how poorly lit it was or how the security doors to the hotel were broken and allowed anyone in, despite what the signs next to the door claimed. Upon checking in to our room, we found our Internet service was non-functioning. After repeated calls to the front desk, I contacted Z-net technical support. We quickly determined the nature of the problem...the DSL modem in the room was broken. However, when I contacted Guest Services, they were unsure what to do. After having their staff check, they discovered they had no spare modems. But instead of simply getting a modem from a customer who wasn't using the internet service (since the hotel was fully booked), they asked me to check with them the next day, after 12PM. While an inconvenience, I did so. They had forgotten about me, however, and we repeated the same process. Wireless Internet service was available in the lobby, but this was inconvenient for more than quick uses in the limited seating and in a public space. Thursday evening, after several visits, the manager on duty and support staff managed to locate a unit and provided it to us, after I showed them where to install it. The manager then offered us the service for free, due to the inconvenience, which we appreciated. We would later have to argue to have this charge removed from the bill, however, as the promise of the manager didn't translate into informing the staff or making proper notation on our hotel information. When I did get access to the Internet, I went to my bank's website to perform some bill-paying. It was then that I noticed that the hotel had put a $1000 hold on my account for our stay, something that I am unclear on why it was done or why we weren't notified of the same. It had no effect on our stay, but seemed to indicate that this Sheraton, unlike others I've stayed with in the past, considered us to be risky customers. More onerous was the fact that $1000 exceeded the cost of our stay, meaning that the Sheraton Centre City was tying up my funds based on their belief that I would be incurring charges of hotel services. I have not experienced this practice at other hotels and found it somewhat insulting. Perhaps the hotel thought I would be buying one of their $4.50 dollars of bottled water they left in the room, but like many other overpriced services at the hotel, we opted to not use them. Had we not been promised free Internet services, we surely would have used it less, as $12.95 is $3 more than I have paid for similar services in any hotel I have stayed at in the past decade, including those in New York City, Columbus, Philadelphia, Baltimore, Orlando and San Diego. Being summer, we were looking forward to using the hotel's pool. The stark reality of the pool, however, we as disappointing. While the pool on the 9th floor did provide an excellent view of Monument Circle, that did little to make up for the fact that it was badly in need of repair. Cracks were visible throughout, and the pool has no steps, only ladders. This made the pool inaccessible for my 8 year-old without my help. Worse, the ladders were no longer bolted properly to the side of the pool, making them less safe. The sharp drop-off of the pool made it less family-friendly, as well, so that I needed to keep my 11 year-old in a small confined area of the pool to ensure her safety. Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Unfortunately, the room had its share of problems, as well. The door jammed every time we used it, often requiring us to spend a full minute just to open it. There were signs the door had been modified with some metal attachments and that's why it stuck. Some of the electrical sockets had faulty wiring and would sometimes work and sometimes not, as I discovered when trying to charge my laptop and our cell-phones. The air-conditioning also malfunctioned several times, changing its output dramatically from night to night, without us changing the thermostat or settings. This resulted in us being freezing cold one night and sweating in bed the next. While I compliment the hotel staff for their general overall friendliness, this was overshadowed by their general lack of knowledge of what do when presented with requests. This was best illustrated when it came time to check out of the hotel. By the end of our stay, I wasn't surprised that our bill showed the charge for Internet service that we'd been told would be free as billed to our account. While courteous, it was clear the desk clerk had no idea about the issue. He then provided the last part of our dissatisfaction for our stay when we 'validated' our parking for the stay. I paid the fee and then went to our car. As we attempted to exit the lot and begin a 10 hour car ride, we found the system said our ticket indicated we had not paid. I stepped out of our car, walked directly through the glass doors and walked straight to the front desk. I then informed the clerk our ticket said we hadn't paid and wasn't allowing us to leave the lot. The clerk then offered that he could take my payment...FORGETTING THAT I HAD PAID HIM LESS THAN FIVE MINUTES AGO. When I pointed this out to him, he buzzed the front gate, allowing us to leave. In summary, my family and I left the Sheraton in Indianapolis having had a good time DESPITE our stay at the hotel, which I remain unhappy about now, over a week later. I have paid less to stay in better hotels in larger cities and gotten better service. I expected better of a Sheraton hotel than this and it has lowered my opinion of the chain as a whole. I know for certain we will NEVER stay at this hotel again and I will be more cautious at staying at any Sheraton in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: luvleightoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed two different nights within the same 2 weeks. The first night, children in the rooms next to us were very loud until after 2:00 a.m. The hotel was very nice, as was the staff. The second time we stayed we received excellent service (and checked in extremely late!). We were placed in a corner room with a beautiful view of the monument and a courtesy goodie bag. Since we had been travelling late, the little perks and goodies were greatly appreciated. Also, it is a great hotel if you are going to a downtown event, with easy access to venues and great eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay!”
Reviews.Author: alhow18
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you are looking for some city living for a few days. The mall and many good restaurants are only few blocks away. Every staff member we came in contact with was very friendly and accommodating. We booked through Hotwire, so we didn't know what Hotel we were getting until we paid. I was kind of nervous after reading some of the reviews. The place is better than most of the reviews I have read on here. The rooms were very clean and comfortable with a great view of the city. My only complaint is that the pool isn't really a good pool for children. It's about 5 feet at its shallow end and is a little cooler than what a indoor heated pool at some of the other hotels would be. Other than that, I really liked being able to swim outside and on the 9th floor!! Great view of the city from the pool deck. Very relaxing. The hallways were a little cool, but I was completely happy with the room temperature and only had to make one adjustment. Some of the hotels I've stayed in require me to make adjustments all night. Overall great experience. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service, Average everything else”
Reviews.Author: noslaw26
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, but outside of the valet workers I think the rest of the employees have been awful.
